result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: To be served straight time, no release privileges.
Court will allow the defendant to participate in the Dosage Probation Program, if eligible.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive. Cash bail to apply. Defendant to make regular monthly payments. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Enroll in a GED program.
Maintain full time employment. If defendant is in school, he may work part time.
Participate in an employment referral program or training program as referred by agent.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests. Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first six months, and then be tested once per month, randomly. 
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
AODA assessment and must enroll in drug treatment.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED, CONSECUTIVE to be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation. Defendant should then be revoked.
**2/16/2015 stay lifted as to 10 days.  Starting from 2/9/15.  Straight time, no good time credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Jermaine Hughes

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case recalled.  Defendant provides proof of enrollment in a HSED class at MCS beginning the first week of September.  Court does not schedule any further review hearings, but agent can bring case back to court to lift the stay if there are any violations.

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court has not received a report from the agent, Darlene Thomas-Winters.  Defendant states he is enrolled in a program to obtain his GED, but did not bring proof with him.  Court finds the defendant has not been in compliance with the conditions of probation and orders him to provide proof of enrollment by 11:00 a.m. today or the stay will be lifted.  Case passed.

Case is assigned for probation review hearing on 8/21/2015 before Judge Konkol.  A substitution was previously done against Konkol, and a new Judge needs to be assigned.  Court contacted attorney Schubert a few times to try to get defendant in to have case recalled.  Counsel did not get in contact with the court to arrange a date to bring case in earlier.   A new Judge will have to be assigned on the next court date.  aw.

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  Defendant ordered to make all home visits and office visits with agent, and to give agent verification that he completed a job program.  Defmedant will serve 10 days in jail if he misses another home visit.  Defendant to also enroll in a GED or HSED by then next court date, or he will spend time in jail.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.    Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.
Case adjourned to 8/21/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 44.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Probation status review report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  Defendant to continue to look for employment and to show agent what he is trying to do to get a job.  Case adjourned to 6/29/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 3.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Notes:  Defense counsel may petition court to cancel review hearing for the defendant if he is working or in a program, and court may cancel hearing.
Probation status review report, received and filed.  aw

Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert in court.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defendant not present in court.  Agent not present in court.  Court contacted agent, and the agent thought the court date was scheduled for 4/23/2015 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned for probation review hearing on 4/23/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per Order for Commitment signed and filed.

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant in custody.  Kurt Behling appeared for the City of Milwaukee.
Case scheduled for return on property hearing.  City does not object to the return of the defendant's cell phone and money.  Court GRANTS return of defendant's cell phone and money with reasons stated on the record.  Defendant to bring in pay stubs from his place of employment at that time the money was taken.  Order signed and filed.  Copy given to parties.  aw

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent not present in court.  Defendant is presently in custody.  Agent is requesting condition time.  Order for commitment for condition time for non-compliance with probation conditions, signed and filed.  Defendant shall spend 10 days in the House of Corrections starting 2/9/2015.  Copy given to parties.  Case adjourned for probation review hearing on 4/13/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Probation Review Report received and filed.  aw
Return of property hearing on February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
MPD Inventory #14015106-14015120(MARK HUGHES).

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The Court has not received any reports from the probation department.  Court ordered the defendant to enroll in drug treatment and GED classes by February.  Court referred the defendant to Word of Hope Ministries and Northcott Neighborhood Services.  Attorney Schubert will notify the defendant's agent of the next court date.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case was set for probation review on sentencing date, and not entered on CCAP.   Case adjourned for probation review hearing on 1/12/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing Hearing continued.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 10 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

Court will allow the defendant to participate in the Dosage Probation Program, if eligible.

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.  Defendant shold then be revoked.
- AODA assessment and must enroll in drug treatment.
- No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first six months, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Enroll in a GED program.
- Maintain full time employment.  If defendant is in school, he may work part time.

- Participate in an employment referral program or training program as referred by agent.
- Complete a cognitive intervention program.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Court orders defendant REFERRED to JUSTICE Point for ENHANCED Supervision.  ALL PREVIOUS CONDITIONS remain.
Defendant came in today to resolve the case.  Court cancels warrant.

Defendant Mark Jermaine Hughes in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 2 OF THE CRIMINAL CRIMINAL COMPLAINT, AND COUNT 1 OF THE INFORMATION:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 10/9/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
